description: Enables you to programmatically view the list of Amazon Web Services Supply Chain data lake datasets. Developers can view the datasets and the corresponding information such as namespace, schema, and so on for a given instance ID and namespace.

parameters.name: instanceId
parameters.description: The Amazon Web Services Supply Chain instance identifier.

parameters.name: namespace
parameters.description: The namespace of the dataset, besides the custom defined namespace, every instance comes with below pre-defined namespaces: asc - For information on the Amazon Web Services Supply Chain supported datasets see https://docs.aws.amazon.com/aws-supply-chain/latest/userguide/data-model-asc.html. default - For datasets with custom user-defined schemas.

nested_items.name: datasets
nested_items.description: The list of fetched dataset details.

nested_items.name: instanceId
nested_items.description: The Amazon Web Services Supply Chain instance identifier.

nested_items.name: namespace
nested_items.description: The namespace of the dataset, besides the custom defined namespace, every instance comes with below pre-defined namespaces:

nested_items.name: name
nested_items.description: The name of the dataset. For asc namespace, the name must be one of the supported data entities under https://docs.aws.amazon.com/aws-supply-chain/latest/userguide/data-model-asc.html.

nested_items.name: arn
nested_items.description: The arn of the dataset.

nested_items.name: name
nested_items.description: The name of the dataset schema.

nested_items.name: fields
nested_items.description: The list of field details of the dataset schema.

nested_items.name: name
nested_items.description: The dataset field name.

nested_items.name: type
nested_items.description: The dataset field type.

nested_items.name: isRequired
nested_items.description: Indicate if the field is required or not.

nested_items.name: primaryKeys
nested_items.description: The list of primary key fields for the dataset. Primary keys defined can help data ingestion methods to ensure data uniqueness: CreateDataIntegrationFlow's dedupe strategy will leverage primary keys to perform records deduplication before write to dataset; SendDataIntegrationEvent's UPSERT and DELETE can only work with dataset with primary keys. For more details, refer to those data ingestion documentations.

nested_items.name: name
nested_items.description: The name of the primary key field.

nested_items.name: description
nested_items.description: The description of the dataset.

nested_items.name: partitionSpec
nested_items.description: The partition specification for a dataset.

nested_items.name: fields
nested_items.description: The fields on which to partition a dataset. The partitions will be applied hierarchically based on the order of this list.

nested_items.name: name
nested_items.description: The name of the partition field.

nested_items.name: transform
nested_items.description: The transformation of the partition field. A transformation specifies how to partition on a given field. For example, with timestamp you can specify that you'd like to partition fields by day, e.g. data record with value 2025-01-03T00:00:00Z in partition field is in 2025-01-03 partition. Also noted that data record without any value in optional partition field is in NULL partition.

nested_items.name: type
nested_items.description: The type of partitioning transformation for this field. The available options are:

nested_items.name: createdTime
nested_items.description: The creation time of the dataset.

nested_items.name: lastModifiedTime
nested_items.description: The last modified time of the dataset.

nested_items.name: nextToken
nested_items.description: The pagination token to fetch next page of datasets.
